alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:07AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong cold front will be moving through central Dolores, central Montezuma and western La Plata Counties through 345 AM MST... At 304 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong front with embedded thunderstorms moving along a line extending from 19 miles southeast of Slick Rock to 14 miles southeast of Dove Creek to near Cortez to 15 miles north of Shiprock. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph will remain possible ahead of and along the frontal passage. Rain will initially fall with the front but switch over to snow...especially at elevations above 6500 feet. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Watch for slippery road conditions to develop as temperatures continue to fall. Locations impacted include... Cortez, Mancos, Dolores, Rico, La Plata, Mayday, Hesperus, Breen, Kline, Marvel, Lebanon, Stoner, Dunton, Redmesa and Mesa Verde Natl Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 29. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 38 and 80. Colorado 140 between mile markers 1 and 23. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
